titleStmt.title: A sermon had at Paulis by the co[m]mandment of the most reuerend father in god my lorde legate, and sayd by Ioh[a]n the bysshop of Rochester, vpo[n] qui[n]quagesom sonday, concernynge certayne heretickes, whiche tha[n] were abiured for holdynge the heresies of Martyn Luther that famous hereticke, and for ye kepyng and reteynyng of his bokes agaynst the ordinance of the bulle of pope Leo the tenthe.
titleStmt.author: Fisher, John, Saint, 1469-1535.

publicationStmt.publisher: In fletestrete, in the house of Thomas Berthelet, nere to the Cundite, at the signe of Lucrece,

notesStmt.note: Imprint from colophon; publication date conjectured by STC.
At foot of title page: Cu[m] priuilegio a rege indulto.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

place.placeName: the house of Thomas Berthelet, nere to the Cundite, at the signe of Lucrece
